name: generate_pdf
description: Generate a professional PDF document from markdown content using Gen-PDF. Supports advanced formatting, code highlighting, math expressions, tables, and customizable styling options including dark mode.

markdownDocument.description:
Markdown content to convert to PDF.
          
## MARKDOWN ELEMENTS AND FEATURES

### 1. Headings
Use hash symbols followed by space and text. Number of hashes = heading level (1-6).
# Heading 1

### 2. Bold
Wrap text with ** or __.
**bold text**

### 3. Italic
Wrap text with * or _.
*italic text*

### 4. Inline Code
Wrap text with backticks.
`code`

### 5. Strikethrough
Wrap text with ~~.
~~strikethrough~~

### 6. Subscript
Wrap text with ~.
H~2~O

### 7. Superscript
Wrap text with ^.
E = mc^2^

### 8. Links
Use [text](url) format.
[Link text](https://example.com)

### 9. Blockquotes
Start lines with >. Use >> for nested quotes.
> This is a quote
>> Nested quote

### 10. Ordered Lists
Start with number + period. Supports: 1., a., A., i., I.
1. First item
2. Second item

### 11. Unordered Lists
Start with - or *.
- Item one
- Item two

### 12. Task Lists
Use - [ ] for unchecked, - [x] for checked.
- [ ] Unchecked task
- [x] Checked task

### 13. Alerts
Use blockquote with [!TYPE] on first line. TYPE can be NOTE, TIP, IMPORTANT, WARNING, CAUTION.
> [!NOTE]
> This is a note

> [!TIP]
> This is a tip

> [!IMPORTANT]
> This is important

> [!WARNING]
> This is a warning

> [!CAUTION]
> This is a caution

### 14. Code Blocks
Wrap with triple backticks and language name.

### 15. Inline Math
Wrap with single $.
$E = mc^2$

### 16. Block Math
Wrap with double $$.
$$
\sum_{i=1}^{n} x_i
$$

### 17. Mermaid Diagrams
Use code block with mermaid language.
### 18. Tables
Use pipes | to separate columns, hyphens for header separator.
| Header 1 | Header 2 |
|----------|----------|
| Cell 1   | Cell 2   |

### 19. Table Alignment
Use colons in separator row.
| Left | Center | Right |
|:-----|:------:|------:|
| A    | B      | C     |

### 20. Table Colspan
Use multiple consecutive pipe characters (|||) to span columns.
| Spans 3 columns |||

### 21. Table Rowspan
Use ^ in cell below to merge with cell above.
| Cell spans |
| two rows ^ |

### 22. Table Footer
Add separator row with |---|.
| Data  |
|-------|
| Value |
|-------|
| Total |

### 23. Footnotes
Reference with [^id], define with [^id]: text.
Text with footnote[^1]

[^1]: Footnote definition

### 24. Citations
You can reference sources with their key in square brackets [key].
The key should point to a source in the .bib text file that you provide alongside the markdown document.
This bib should be formatted in the correct .bib format.

According to research [smith2023]

// Bibtex example
@article{smith2023,
author = {Smith, John and Carter, Emily},
title = {The Importance of Sleep for Cognitive Function},
journal = {Journal of Sleep Research},
year = {2023},
volume = {12},
number = {3},
pages = {100-115},
doi = {10.1111/jsr.2023.12001}
}

### 25. Description Lists
Use : term : definition format.
: Term 1 : Definition 1
: Term 2 : Definition 2

## 26. Landscape
You can use the landscape element to add some content on a new landscape page.
This is useful when you want to add a large table that won't fit on a portrait page.
[landscape]
This content will be displayed on a new landscape page.
[/landscape]

## 27. Blocks
You can use the block element to add a block page to the document with the following syntax:
Blocks are useful when you want to position content on a specific side of the document, like tucking an address or sigtaylor-and-francis-chicago-author-date on the right or left side.
Blocks can have the following options:
- pos: left, right, center
- width: a number expressing percentage of the page width
- textalign: left, center, right, justify
- spacey: a number in em expressing the space before and after the block
[block pos=right width=30% textalign=right spacey=10em]
This block will be positioned on the right side of the page and will have a width of 30% of the page width.
[/block]

## 28. Abstract
You can use the abstract element to add an abstract to the document with the following syntax:
Abstracts are useful when you want to add a summary of the document to the beginning of the document.
Abstracts can have the following options:
- title: the title of the abstract
- textalign: left, center, right, justify
- spacey: a number in em expressing the space before and after the abstract
[abstract title="Abstract" textalign=justify spacey=10em]
This abstract will have a width of 80% of the page width.
[/abstract]

## 29. Bibliography
You can use the bibliography element to add a bibliography to the document with the following syntax:
Bibliography can have the following options:
- title: the title of the bibliography 
- style: the style of the bibliography can be one of the supported bibliography styles
the tag does not need to be closed it is self closing.
[bibliography title="Bibliography" style="taylor-and-francis-chicago-author-date"]

## 30 TOC
You can use the toc element to add a table of contents to the document with the following syntax:
Toc can have the following options:
- title: the title of the toc
- depth: the depth of the toc
- indent: the indent of the toc
the tag does not need to be closed it is self closing.
[toc title="Table of Contents" depth=2 indent=10pt]

bibliography.description: Bibliography text file in .bib format that will be used to reference sources in the document.

toc.description:
Use this setting to add a table of contents to the PDF document at the beginning of the document. 
You may want to add it if the document is long and you want to be able to navigate through it easily.
